On 18 May 2010 18:06, Ken <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
>
> I wanted to add a little context on pole balancing.
[...]

Ken, I agree with your points. As you say it does still form an
interesting baseline example of a real-time control task, much like
XOR is a baseline task but not particularly interesting by itself.

Also the physics model point isn't particularly significant because
it's already a simplification of the real world (no air or joint
friction, outside vibration, air flow, etc.). It's a simple physics
model that provides enough of the complexities of real word physics to
stand as a good (but simple) control task.

Colin.
